page.title: 01N.W.Chard & Its Villages
page.content: Apart from the buildings along{Combe {Street}and{High Street}this part of {Chard}was built mainly after WW2. In area it is approx 1/6 of the town. {Wadeford and Chardleigh Green}to the N.have become something of dormitory villages in contrast to{Whitestaunton} to the W.where there is little other than farming development. The block lies on the S.end of the {Blackdown Hills}and is dominated by {Snowdon Hill,219m.}The town itself is said to be the highest in{Somerset} with the main part above 110m. Although referred to as{Chard}in the text,9/10 of the block is open country devoted mainly to{dairy farming. } There is a small{tourist}trade but Chard,which celebrated its 750 years as a Borough in 1985,is generally known only as a place that holiday makers pass through on their way West.
